text: An article used as a means of exchange in the early days of trade in West Africa was
explanation: In the history of commerce, the Arab merchants brought goods like salt, cowries, copper, cloth, books, etc which were exchanged for kola nuts, slaves, gold, hides etc.

text: The provision of services is classified under
explanation: Tertiary production is concerned with the provision of services to the people e.g doctors, lawyers, teachers, policemen etc.

text: The growth of commerce is not enhanced by

options.A: development of modern forms of production

explanation: Low per capita income is one of the factors affecting the growth of commerce in West Africa. However, the factors that encourage the growth of commerce are: emergence of specialization, development of modern forms of production, government participation, population growth, role of advertising etc.

text: One of the products of the construction industry is a
explanation: Constructive industry is concerned with all the activities of those who engage in assembling of goods manufactured into useable form e.g road construction, bridge construction etc.

text: The service of a retailer is part of production because it

options.A: creates a link between consumers and producers
options.B: enables finished goods to reach consumers

explanation: A retailer is a trader who buys goods in small quantities from the wholesaler and sells in bits or units to the final consumers. One of the function is that he breaks the goods down into units for the consumers.

text: The resources put together to create goods and services are
explanation: Factors of production are the agents, components or resources which are combined together to produce goods and services. The factors of production are: land, labour, capital and entreprenuer.

text: Which of the following organizations provide essential goods and services at low cost to citizens?
explanation: Public enterprise is also known as statutory cooperation or public corporation. It is set up, owned and financed by the government to provide services to the members of the public.

text: A group of sellers who pool their resources to buy goods in large quantities and sell to its members is a
explanation: Wholesale co-operative society is formed by small scale wholesalers who purchase goods in bulk from the manufacturers at a reasonable price and sell in small quantities to retail co-operative.

text: Average stock is derived by adding

options.A: closing stock to purchase divided by 2
options.C: opening stock to closing stock divided by 2

explanation: Average stock is calculated as : Opening stock + Closing stock/2

text: A retail business that sells goods by post, using catalogue is a
explanation: Mail order firm sells goods by mail order or by post rather than through retail premises. The firm uses catalog marketing with direct merchandise shipment to customers.

text: Which of the following documents would a shareholder inspect to know his voting rights?
explanation: Article of Association is a document in which the regulations which govern the internal management of the company's affairs, the duties, rights and power of the members are stated. The content contains:- the method of issue capital- method of holding meetings-the rights of shareholders- method of sharing dividend etc

text: An internal source of finance to an enterpreneur is
explanation: Internal source of finance refer to money that comes from within a business. There are several internal methods an entrepreneur can use, including owners capital, retained profit and selling assets.

text: A partner who contributes only his name to the formation of a partnership is
explanation: A nominal partner is also known as Quasi partner. he only contributes his name to the formation of the business. He neither contributes capital nor take part in the management of the firm.

text: Which of the following groups would advocate for the supply of constant electricity to households?
explanation: Consumer's association are advocacy groups that seek to protect people from corporate abuse like unsafe products, predatory lending, false advertising,pollution etc.

text: A retail store that sells a single product from a particular manufacturer is a
explanation: A chain store is a group of retail stores of essentially the same type centrally owned with some degree of centralised control of operation and selling the same range of products.

text: A country's visible balance of payment is made up of

options.A: interest on loans to foreign countries

explanation: A country's visible balance of payment is made up of earnings from goods exported. The balance of payment transactions consist of imports and exports of goods, services, and capital, as well as as transfer payment, such as foreign aid and remittances.

text: The quality of money which makes it possible to buy goods in small quantities is
explanation: Money must be capable of being divided into smaller units to enable it to purchase both high and low priced commodities. Therefore, the quality of money which makes it possible to buy goods in small quantities is divisibility

text: One of the functions of commerical banks that cannot be performed by central banks is

options.B: collection of deposits from the public

explanation: Commercial banks are financial institutions which accept deposits and other valuables from the public for safekeeping with the sole aim of making profit. One of the functions of commercial banks is the acceptance of deposit and lending to customer etc.

text: A document that instructs an agent to buy goods from a named firm is
explanation: A close indent restricts the agent to a named manufacturer from whom the goods must be obtained.

text: The incentive given to a buyer to encourage prompt payment is
explanation: Cash discount is given in order to encourage prompt payment. For example: "2/7; Net 30 means that if the customer pays within 7 days of receiving the goods, he may take 2% off the amount stated in the invoice, if he does not, he will have to pay the full amount stated in the invoice within 30 days.

text: The principle which prevents an insured from receiving a claim that is more than the value of the loss, if the property is insured by more than one company is
explanation: Contribution is one of the principle of insurance, this principle prevents the insured from making profit from the insurance because it is a contract of good faith.

text: Dealers in stock exchange such as bulls, bears and stags are categorized as
explanation: Dealers in the stock exchange market are known as speculator. The speculators are: the bears, the bull and the stag.

text: Which of the following is not a characteristic of a commercial bank?

options.D: Established with the view of making profit

explanation: The characteristics of commercial banks are:- it is a limited liability company- the motive for its establishment is profit making- they are members of the money market- commercial banks are incorporated- they accept deposits and other valuables.- they are owned by private individuals, institutions or governments.

text: Central banks sell treasury bills to the public to

options.A: increase cash in the banking system

explanation: Hence, by issuing treasury bills, central banks can raise short-term fund for governments and absorb surplus liquidity from financial markets simultaneously. Therefore, when there is too much money in circulation, the central bank will sell securities to reduce money surply in the economy.

text: A document used to ensure correct payment of duty at the importing country is
explanation: Bill of lading is a document of title giving the holder a right to take possession of the goods to which it refers. It is divided into:- Clean bill of lading: if no damage occurred to the goods.- Dirty or foul bill of lading: indicates some deficiencies, irregularities or damage on the goods

text: A cheque is specially crossed if

options.A: the name of the account holder is written between two parallel lines drawn across it
options.B: it could be paid over the counter
options.C: the name of the bank is written between two parallel lines drawn across it
options.D: only two parallel lines are drawn across it

explanation: In special crossing, the name of the bank is inserted between the transerve lines. This restrict payment to a specific name bank.

text: One of the functions of a trade association is to
explanation:
FUNCTIONS OF TRADE ASSOCATION
- Provide trade, Pool trade and credit information- Fix minimum price for their goods- Assist needy members- Educate members on trade activities- Settle dispute among members.- Preventing cut-throat or unfair competition- Promoting and extending trade through "legislative work'

text: When a share with a nominal value of #50 is quoted at #70, it is being sold
explanation: Shares at a premium is a situation whereby shares are quoted above the nominal value i.e the issue price is greater than the nominal value.

text: Sea vessels that do not operate on regular times and routes are
explanation: Ocean liners sail through high sea and oceans following strict routes and schedules e.g. Atlantic, Indian and Pacific oceans. It is divided into Passenger liners and Cargo liners.

text: Payment made to a carrier for transportation of goods is
explanation: Freight means the cost or payment of shipping a particular cargo for a specific voyage.

text: An advantage of rail transport is that it
explanation: Rail transport is a means of conveying goods and passengers by train. The advantages of rail transport are:- suitable for long distance- standard rate of charges- suitable for heavy and bulky goods- it is very cheap-high capacity- less prone to accident- train operates in schedule

text: The commission on a postal order is
explanation: Postal order is a means of payment provided by post office for transfer of small sum of money. A commission known as POUNDAGE is charged on postal order and it valid for 6 month.

text: Consumers could be encouraged to purchase a company's product through
explanation: Advertising is a branch of commerce which is used to create awareness for a particular product and it must be paid for. Advertising informs, educates and persuades people to buy the advertised goods and services.

text: The marketing concept emphasizes

options.A: sales of goods directly to customers
options.B: use of promotional tools to stimulate sale

explanation: The marketing concept refers to the principle that the consumer is sovereign i.e. the consumer should be treated as "kings" and it is assumed that consumer is always right. The ideas behind marketing concept are:- Consumer orientation: It emphasizes on understanding consumers' real needs, and satisfying them better than any competitor.- Consumer satisfaction: A measurement that determines how happy customers are with a company's products, services, and capabilities.- Integrated marketing: An approach to creating a unified and seamless experience for consumers to interact with the brand/enterprises, it also attempts to meld all aspect of marketing communication such as advertising, sales promotion, public relations, direct marketing, and social media through their respective mix of tactics, methods ,channel, media and activities.

text: An undertaking to repair a customer's vehicle for a certain period after it has been sold is
explanation: After-sale services is a services renders to the buyer or customers after the sale of the products. It is a form of customer service.

text: Which of the following is not a right of a consumer?
explanation: Rights of consumers are:- they have the right to safety- they have the right to be informed- they have to right to choose between alternatives- they have the right to good things of life- they have the right to be heard- they have the right to seek redress to correct any injustice

text: Advertisement which is geared towards a particular audience is
explanation: Direct advertising is a method of advertising which is aimed at providing information to a section, target market segment or group of people with relatively similar needs.

text: The law by which a seller transfers the property in goods to a buyer at an agreed price is the
explanation: The Sales of goods act was introduced to regulate the respective rights and duties of the vendor and purchaser. The sales of goods act is a contract whereby the seller transfers or agrees to transfer the property in goods to the buyer for a money consideration called the price.

text: Commerce is defined as

options.A: buying and selling of goods and services only
options.B: all activities in the distribution and exchange of goods and services
options.C: all activities involved in the production of goods and services
options.D: transporting and warehousing of goods only

explanation: Commerce can simply be defined as all the activities involved in the distribution and exchange of goods and services.

text: The type of occupation that a broker belongs to is
explanation: Commercial occupation refers to all the people involved in the distribution and exchange of goods produced by the industrial sector e.g bankers, transporter, traders, advertisers, insurers, importers etc.

text: A form of money which was not used in the early days of trade is
explanation: In the olden days, different commodities served as money in different countries. Cattle, cowries, shells, tobacco, salt and beads were used as medium of exchange at one period or another.

text: Which of the following activities is not an example of the extractive industry?
explanation: Extractive occupation are those who engage in obtaining raw materials and natural resources from the soil or sea e.g farming, quarrying, mining, hunting, lumbering, fishing.

text: A business unit in which savings of members are lent to others is a
explanation: Credit and Thrift society is an association of low income earners who joinlty pool large resources or fund together by contributing on a weekly or monthly basis. This type of society encourages savings habits among their members grant loans to the members out of the accumulated fund.

text: The document issued by a public company allowing it to commence business is the
explanation: Certificate of trading is the document which allows the company to commence business activities. It is issued after the company had been given the certificate of incorporation.

text: Which of the following is not a function of a consumer association?

options.A: Ensuring that consumers buy quality goods
options.D: Ensuring that fair prices are charged

explanation: Consumer associations primarily focus on educating consumers about their rights, ensuring the quality of products, and advocating for fair pricing. However, the enforcement of penalties against importers of counterfeit goods is usually the responsibility of regulatory and law enforcement agencies rather than consumer associations.

text: An association formed by computer distributors to safeguard and promote their interest is a
explanation: Trade association is an association of traders or producers engaged in the same line of trade whose major aim is to protect and safeguard the interest of their members as well as their business.

text: The issue of prospectus by a company is an invitation to members of the public to

options.B: attend the company's Annual general Meeting

explanation: Prospectus is an invitation to the public to purchase shares or debentures.

text: Examples of current assets are

options.C: trade debtors, trade creditors and cash

explanation: Current assets are assets which are usually held for the a short period of time for the purpose of conversion in the ordinary course of business e.g stock, cash in hand/bank, bills receivable, debtors etc

text: When the cost of sales is divided by the average stock, the result is
explanation: Rate of stock turnover also known as stock turnover is the number of times stock are used up in an organization and it is calculated as:Rate of stock turnover = cost of goods sold / Average stock

text: The part of issued share capital that the company has asked the subscribers to pay for
explanation: Called - up capital is part of issued capital that has actually been called up, and the shareholders have been asked to make payment. It is part of issued capital which is expected of the shareholders to pay for.

text: The last link in a channel of distribution is the
explanation: The channel of distribution is the path through which goods move from the producer to the consumers i.e. from the manufacturer to the wholesaler, from the wholesaler to the retailer and from the retailer to the final consumer which is the last link.

text: The difference between a country's imports and exports of goods in a particular year is
explanation: Balance of payment refers to the difference between a country's payment for visible and invisible exports and imports. If exports payments exceeds import payments, then it is a favorable balaace of payment and vice-versa

text: Goods bought into the country for sale are the country's
explanation: Visible imports consist of goods that can been seen and touched i.e tangible goods which come from other countries e.g electronics, rice etc

text: A feature of supermarkets which distinguishes it from other large scale retail outlets is that items sold are
explanation: A super market is a large retailing business units selling mainly food and household items on the basis of high turnover, wide variety and assortment, self services with emphasis on merchandise appeal.

text: One advantage of small scale retail outlets is

options.C: easy acess to large amount of capital

explanation: The reasons or advantages for the survival of small scale retailers are:- small capital- combination with other work- quick decison making- personal relationship- sales in smaller quantity

text: A discount deducted from the invoice price of goods to enable the retailer to make profit
explanation: Cash discount is the amount deducted from invoice price for realizing outstanding sales amount.It is given to a customer to encourage payments for goods and services within a stipulated period of time.

text: A document issued by the seller's own courier and signed by the customer to acknowledge receipt of the goods is
explanation: Consignment note is a document supplied to a carrier when goods are to be sent from one place to another. It gives details of the goods, number of packages, weight, name and address of the sender and consignee. The document after being completed by the sender is handed over to the carrier and signed by consignee on the delivery of the goods, thus providing proof of delivery.

text: A request for goods from another country by an importer would be made using
explanation: Indent is a document used in international trade to buy goods conveyed by an importer to a potential supplier. The two types of indent are: closed an open indent.

text: The right to buy or sell stock in the stock exchange within a stipulated period is
explanation: Stock option gives an investor the right, but not the obligation, to buy or sell a stock at an agreed upon price and date.

text: The share value stated on a share certificate is
explanation: Nominal value is also known as par value or face value. Per value for a share refers to the stock value stated in the corporate charter. Share usually have no par value or very low par value, such as one cent per share.

text: The bank which acts as the lender of last resort is the
explanation: The central bank performs the following functions:- act as lender as last resort- Facilitates international trade- Act as bankers bank- Issue out country's currency

text: An insurance policy which is not a contract of indemnity is
explanation: Contract of indemnity is a contract by which one party promises to save the other from loss caused to him by the conduct of the promisor himself, or by the conduct of any other person

text: When a company insures the lives of all its employees collectively, the policy is
explanation: Group insurance is taken to cover a group of people or workers.These are policies on a collective basis,assuring members of a particular group such as football team or a group of employees of a firm.

text: A cheque that could be cashed over the counter by the payee is
explanation: An open cheque also referred to as a bearer cheque, describes any cheque that is not crossed and may be cashed at the teller counter with the funds being provided directly to the payee.

text: A specially-designed mode of transport for conveying liquid and gas is a
explanation: A tanker is a ship designed to transport or store liquids or gases in bulk.

text: The safe keeping of goods produced until they are needed is
explanation: Warehousing is a building for storing goods which are used by manufacturers, importers, exporters, wholesalers, transport businesses, customs etc.

text: One of the objectives of the Niger Basin Commission is to

options.A: regulate the movement of citizens across borders
options.B: improve tariff and quota on non-members
options.C: regulate the movement of cargo along the river
options.D: streaming the construction of dams on the river

explanation: The objectives of the commission are:- To guide navigations on the Niger river- To ensure the most effective utilisation of the resources of river- To streamline the construction of dams on the Niger- To ensure the most effective use the Niger water- To undertake schemes to control floods and erosion- To promote studies on the agricultural potentials of River Niger

text: A paid presentation about a product with a view to encouraging purchases by an identifiable sponsor is
explanation: Advertising can be defined as paid form of non-personal communication which is directed to the customers or target audience through various media in order to present and promote products, services and ideas. It is a paid presentation.

text: The face-to-face meeting of the seller with the buyer for the purpose of making sales is
explanation: Personal selling involves the direct personal contact of sellers with the potential buyers with view to making sales.It can also be referred to the face - to - face meeting of the salemen with the potential buyers in their houses, offices or market place.

text: The activity which improves the appearance of a product and also aimed at protecting it is
explanation: Labelling is essential as it helps to grab the attention of a customer it can be combined with packaging and can be used by marketers to encourage potential buyers to purchase the product.

text: Which of the following is not a component of the marketing mix?
explanation: The marketing mix are price, place, product and promotion and they are known as the 4P's of marketing.

text: The marketing term which regards the consumer as king that must be satisfied is
explanation: The marketing concept is the belief that companies must assess the needs of their companies first and foremost and based on the decisions in order to satisfy their consumers' needs, better than their competition.

text: An agreement that is enforceable in law is
explanation: A contract is an agreement between two parties ( the offeree and the offeror) which is enforceable in the court of law.

text: A contract will not be discharge through
explanation: Contract can be terminated by:- agreement- breach- performance- frustration- insanity of the offeree or offferor- Lapse of time............ etc

text: A person engaged for the purpose of bringing his principal and a third party into a contractual relation is
explanation: Agent is a person who acts on behalf of another person or group or a person who link the third party with the principal.

text: The management function which involves measuring outcomes and taking corrective action to reduce error is
explanation: Controlling involves setting standards, measuring progress with the set standard and taking corrective action to minimise or avoid errors, thus achieving the objectives.

text: A medium for intra-departmental communication is all except
explanation: Intra-departmental communication involves the sending and receiving of information within the departments of an organisation. The various media of communication available are : intercom, circular, direct communication, bells, buzzers and notice boards.

text: Which of the following is not an objective of ECOWAS?

options.C: encouragement of free movement of people
options.D: encouragement of trade among member countries

explanation: The objectives of Ecowas are:- to expand trade among countries by widening the markets in the region- to improve the transport and communication system i.e infrastructural facilities- to ensure free movement of factors of production- to maintain economic and political stability- to foster closer relations among member countries
